body:
Turn 1: Forest, Arbor Elf
Turn 2: land; unable to cast a spell that costs 3 mana

This is a rather large deviation from how Arbor Elf plays in Magic. It's because you can't use its Forest-untapping ability while paying for mana costs, unlike in Magic. This makes its "virtual mana" only available for casting multiple cheap spells in succession, but not one more expensive one.
author: [core...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/103434827021553153452/)
title: Arbor Elf doesn't mana accelerate under current deviant rules

comments.body:
This is due to a lack of mana pool. As a consequence, when paying mana cost, only mana abilities can be activated.

**Status:** Accepted  
  **Labels:** -Type-Defect Type-Enhancement

comments.body:
is this means Magarena will find somehow to implement "mana pool"?
this can open opportunity to "Priest of Ghix", "Dark Ritual",....  :)
comments.author: [huanghon...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/117260737072923055970/)

comments.body:
It is something we think about, but we don't have a way to do it yet as the AI strongly relies on two assumptions
1) each mana source produces only one mana and
2) only mana abilities are activated when paying mana
